question: Half the right-wing money in New York is here tonight. They came to see you. If you impress them, if you do what I know you can, this movement will be up and running by tomorrow. And on the front page of the New York Times in six months.
answer: We tested the new bomb.

question: What?
answer: We redesigned the timing mechanism. It can't possibly malfunction.

question: Danny, please. Just give your speech.... And nothing about Jews, okay?
answer: Shema yisroel adonai elohenu adonai echod. Who knows what that is?

question: Kyle...I can't talk right now....
answer: Did you kill Ilio Manzetti?

question: No.
answer: Did you kill him? Two days ago you addressed a Nazi rally. Last week you went to a Torah study group.

question: What were you, following me?
answer: How do you reconcile the two?

question: I don't. Look, stay out of what you don't understand.
answer: Explain it so I can.

question: You work for the New York Times. Your whole job in life is not to understand things like me.
answer: I don't think you know what you are.

question: Yeah, and what are you? A Times man? A Presbyterian? Impotent? A prick?
answer: Who killed Manzetti?

question: If I tell you, will you pull the story? Not write about me?
answer: It's too late.... If I didn't, somebody else would. Yom Kippur starts at sundown. Will you go to synagogue?

question: You're telling me you killed him? You? Killed him? Bullshit. What kind of gun did you use?
answer: A forty-five.

question: It was a nine millimeter.
answer: You're lying.

question: So are you... But they'll believe you.... Lina Moebius is saying the whole thing was your idea. That you proposed it in a meeting at her house. Ah, Jesus, Danny... What were you thinking? Are you glad Manzetti's dead? Do you really want to kill Jews? You want to kill me?
answer: I was just talking. I -- look, I can't help what I think.

question: All right, what if all along you were actually infiltrating the Nazis -- to expose them....
answer: But I wasn't.

question: And only talked about killing Manzetti to convince them you were an anti-Semite. If you'd had any idea somebody would take it seriously, you never would have said it.
answer: I can't say that.

question: Think about your father. Your sister.
answer: The truth doesn't mean anything to you, does it?

question: Danny, I'm trying to -- save you.
answer: Fucking kike.

question: Try to get Lina Moebius on tape, telling you to do something. Something violent... That's right, I don't care about truth. I care about you. Kol Nidre's at six-thirty. I've got to meet Stuart. We'll be at the minyan tonight and tomorrow. If you need me, come there....
answer: What's going on?

question: What's going on?
answer: It's erev Yom Kippur.... We'll have dinner, then go to shul. Atone for our sins. Come on, we can be like Eichmann. He studied Torah. He hated Jews.

question: Is it like Eichmann? Are we goofing?
answer: I don't know. I just want to try it.

question: Shit... Did you talk to your mother today?
answer: No. What are you looking for?

question: Nothing. Why are you doing this? I thought God didn't exist.
answer: He commands it whether He exists or not... Look, we can fight him and be crushed. Or we can submit.

question: And be crushed.
answer: Yeah, okay. But what if...what if... submitting...being crushed, being nothing, not mattering, what if that's the best feeling we can have? Look, just light the candles with me. Then we'll eat. You have to eat.

question: Hello...?
answer: Lina... It's happening. Tonight.

question: What is happening?
answer: Beth Shalom. Like you wanted.

question: Beth Shalom? What are you talking about? Who is this...?
answer: Lina, you said if I was going to plant a bomb, I should -- How're we doing?

question: Lina, you said if I was going to plant a bomb, I should -- How're we doing?
answer: That's all we've got left.

question: It'll be enough if we use it right. Okay, the service'll go about another hour. Say an hour for the janitors, then one more just to be safe... We'll go in at midnight.
answer: Didn't you get anything?

question: Oh, what is this shit?
answer: Keep driving. Don't slow down.

question: Christ...
answer: Not too fast.

question: You said they didn't have night guards.
answer: They don't. I checked twenty times.... Somebody must have talked.

question: Who even knew?
answer: Mrs. Moebius.

question: Why? Why would she?
answer: The Manzetti thing must have scared her. She thinks she'll get implicated.

question: So what do we do with the device?
answer: Take a right on 59th... We'll put it someplace else.

question: Where?
answer: I have an idea.... Over here.

question: It's all reinforced in here. It's not going to blow out the way we want it.... If I went back to the lumberyard, the guy'd give me all the dynamite I wanted. Untraceable, you wouldn't -- need to...
answer: No, it has to be tomorrow. You won't get this many of them in here for another year. It'll be fine.

question: It's not going to be fine. It's --
answer: Just do it.

question: What's that?
answer: It's just somebody on the street.

question: When do you want it to go off?
answer: Seven-thirty tomorrow evening.

question: ...You're saying that when he first appeared at your house, you had no idea he was Jewish....
answer: None whatsoever. But I have to admit, I'm not terribly surprised.

question: What do you mean?
answer: I think anti-semitism today is largely a Jewish phenomenon. Wouldn't you agree?

question: In the Third Reich, weren't a number of high-ranking Nazis of Jewish origin?
answer: Yes, and they were said to be the most virulent proponents of the Final Solution. Really, who but a Jew would want to kill Ilio Manzetti simply because he was Jewish? Who thinks about such things?

question: The papers are going to report tomorrow that your colleague, Curtis Zampf, has been a federal informant for the past two years. Do you believe that?
answer: Curtis is always more complicated than he seems. Even now.
